page.title: 09SOUTH LANDING, FLAMBOROUGH
page.content: South Landing is a cut in the cliffs. At one time it was an important port in the area. Today there is a disused lifeboat station at the side of the beach. A few cobles are launched from there. The steep slopes at the side of teh cut are wooded. Recently the nature trail has been made in to an invalid walk. The path has been widened and made more level so that people in wheelchairs can go round the walk. At the top of the cut there is an information centre, it sells leaflets and tells you about the life in the sea. There are a lot of walks starting at South Landing, one goes to Beacon Hill and another one goes to the lighthouse. The beach is quite sandy but there is a lot of seaweed. You can find lots of creatures on the beach; limpets, crabs, cockles, muscles, winkles, shrimp and seals.
